oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Blair T. Hunt
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Hooks Brothers
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Embracing Citizenship
Military Service
African American soldiers; African Americans in military service; World War, 1914-1918
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Formal studio portrait of Lt. Blair T. Hunt in WW I uniform, with Chaplain's Corps insignia on collar.

Hunt served in France during WWI with the Chaplain's Corps. The college educated Hunt served as Principal of Booker T. Washington High School and as Pastor of the Mississippi Boulevard Christian Church, all the while working for opportunity for African Americans. He was a founder of the Memphis Urban League and the "Negro" YMCA.
